org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.protocol

Class TestOperatorRecordBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.test.BaseTest
      • org.apache.drill.test.DrillTest
        • org.apache.drill.test.SubOperatorTest
          • org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.protocol.TestOperatorRecordBatch

  • public class TestOperatorRecordBatch
extends SubOperatorTest
    Test the implementation of the Drill Volcano iterator protocol that wraps the modular operator implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • testNormalLifeCycle

        public void testNormalLifeCycle()
        Simulate a normal run: return some batches, encounter a schema change.

      • testTruncatedLifeCycle

        public void testTruncatedLifeCycle()
        Simulate a truncated life cycle: next() is never called. Not a valid part of the protocol; but should be ready anyway.

      • testSchemaEOF

        public void testSchemaEOF()
        Simulate reaching EOF when trying to create the schema.

      • testFirstBatchEOF

        public void testFirstBatchEOF()
        Simulate reaching EOF on the first batch. This simulated data source discovered a schema, but had no data.

      • testFailEarly

        public void testFailEarly()
        Simulate the caller failing the operator before getting the schema.

      • testFailWhileReading

        public void testFailWhileReading()
        Simulate the caller failing the operator before EOF.

      • testFailBeforeClose

        public void testFailBeforeClose()
        Simulate the caller failing the operator after EOF but before close. This is a silly time to fail, but have to handle it anyway.

      • testFailAfterClose

        public void testFailAfterClose()
        Simulate the caller failing the operator after close. This is violates the operator protocol, but have to handle it anyway.

      • testBatchAccessor

        public void testBatchAccessor()
        The record batch abstraction has a bunch of methods to work with a vector container. Rather than simply exposing the container itself, the batch instead exposes various container operations. Probably an artifact of its history. In any event, make sure those methods are passed through to the container accessor.

      • testSchemaChange

        public void testSchemaChange()

      • testSv2

        public void testSv2()
        Test that an SV2 is properly handled by the proper container accessor.
